Key Match Events: Tim Pringle and Logan van Beek's three-wicket hauls backed up by Max O'Dowd's patient half-century got Netherlands over the line in a nervy chase
O'Dowd had a huge slice of luck when Paudel spilled a straightforward chance in the 18th over at long-off
De Leede then finished the chase with a four through covers, triggering a sigh of relief in the Netherlands camp and securing two crucial points
Pre-Game Insights: Early-morning rain and overcast conditions delayed the toss by 30 minutes
Netherlands captain Scott Edwards had no hesitations in bowling after winning the toss
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Paudel was resilient but fell right before the death overs started
Nepal apply the choke in the middle overs, bowling 19 dot balls in the powerplay as Netherlands reached 36 for 1 after the first six
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Grand Prairie Stadium can seat 7000 but the vocal Nepal fans made it feel a lot bigger, flocking in nice and early getting behind their team
In the first six overs, Nepal played and missed 17 of the 36 balls (47.22%), which is the highest for any team in a men's T20I (for which ESPNcricinfo has ball-by-ball data available)
Others: Tim Pringle, the Netherlands bowler, was praised for his decision to keep giving the ball flight, which paid off as Aasif Sheikh's thick outside edge found short third in the second over
